result.execSummary:
The defendant Brom M. Costa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with Julia Ann Grover. 
--------------------------

Participate in Veteran's Treatment Court. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------

TOTAL BOND COVERS 14CF392 AND 14GF846 (14-4104)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.G. OR HER RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
